832.png.caption1: Under former U.S. President Donald Trump, Congress passed a law that gives outgoing presidential administrations control of American armed forces after Inauguration Day, for up to 60 days.
832.png.caption2: While it was true that Congress, under Trump, established a law that requires the GSA to provide services to outgoing presidents for up to 60 days after Inauguration Day, the legislation did not give those politicians or their administrations the authority to direct any federal department, including the armed forces, after their successor takes office.

834.jpg.caption1: Photographs show a real trampoline bridge in Paris.
834.jpg.caption2: Photos of a ‘Trampoline Bridge’ Don’t Show a Real Structure

835.jpg.caption1: A person walking on streets of Kayamandi
835.jpg.caption2: Kayamandi is groaning under a fast-growing population

837.jpg.caption2: This photograph was taken by Kevin Billington by the River Itchen in Hampshire

852.jpg.caption1: The Yorkshire Sculpture Park, just before the last lockdown on the last permitted family trip.

857.jpg.caption1: The F.B.I. investigated whether the firing of Mr. Comey was a national security threat.
857.jpg.caption2: James Comey was fired in May 2017 - just months after Donald Trump took office

860.png.caption1: A video shows a member of the Maasai tribe whipping people in Kenya who refused to obey the government's self-quarantine orders during the COVID-19 pandemic.
860.png.caption2: While the person in this video is not a member of the Maasai tribe who was employed by the Kenyan government to whip people who disobeyed self-quarantining orders, the video was taken in Kenya during the COVID-19 pandemic and shows a person who is encouraging (in their own weird way) social distancing.

866.jpg.caption1: Donald Trump's son Eric said that Hispanic people should be sent back to Asia.
866.jpg.caption2: A fake news article claimed that Eric Trump said that his father Donald Trump should send Hispanics back to Asia.

871.jpg.caption1: Vladimir Putin said that 'ISIS will regret' assassinating a Russian ambassador since he is 'not Obama' and this is 'not Benghazi.'
871.jpg.caption2: A quote ostensibly uttered by Russian president Vladimir Putin criticizing President Obama is a fabricated one.

873.jpg.caption1: Mr Read, 55, took up the hobby for the first time a year ago

875.jpg.caption1: In July 2017, Don Moen died of "stomach pain".
875.jpg.caption2: Don Moen during the Canada Tour 2015 at the Prayer Palace, Toronto

881.jpg.caption1: A bird in the hand: "I found this little wren in Kinlochewe after it had flown indoors by mistake and had tired itself out"

889.jpg.caption1: Hillary Clinton was accidentally killed during the filming of a documentary about her.
889.jpg.caption2: Hillary Clinton hadn’t been performing “stunts” for a documentary about her, much less been killed in the process.

892.jpg.caption1: In 2014, the Missouri state government issued "nigger hunting" licenses.
892.jpg.caption2: The pictured license was not issued by the state of Missouri, nor did it provide the holder the legal right to hunt and kill African-Americans.

898.png.caption1: U.S. President Joe Biden signed an executive order giving China access to or control over the U.S. power grid system, causing the Texas power outage of February 2021.
898.png.caption2: Biden didn’t sign an executive order granting China access to or control over the U.S. power grid system.

905.jpg.caption1: Photographs show a damaged jet engine repaired with seatbelts during a refueling stop
905.jpg.caption2: While the pictures do show an engine that has been removed from an aircraft, they do not document a case of substandard repairs

908.jpg.caption1: Heavy snowfall in the UK. The Met Office issued yellow weather alerts for Saturday
908.jpg.caption2: A man clears snow from his car in Auchterarder, Perth and Kinross

918.jpg.caption1: President Obama is set to replace the bald eagle with Bison as the U.S.'s national animal.
918.jpg.caption2: National Bison Legacy Act is to adopt the North American bison as the national mammal of the United States. The legislation made no mention of changing or replacing the bald eagle's status.

938.jpeg.caption1: A video shows "CNN reporter" Jade Sacker filming a pro-Trump mob storm the U.S. Capitol.
938.jpeg.caption2: Sacker appeared on CNN because she was a witness to the Capitol riot, not because she was employed by CNN

939.png.caption1: Paints face and hair like the Joker, goes to South Beach, climbs up on a car with an American flag, screams “Fucking COVID is over baby!” and makes it rain
939.png.caption2: Because the virus is not contained in any sense of that word, and because only 13% of Americans are fully vaccinated, the Joker’s assertion that COVID is “over” is “False.”

943.png.caption1: A photograph shows Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes.
943.png.caption2: This isn’t even the first time that Ku Klux Klan robes have been digitally inserted into an image during the 2016 presidential election.

956.jpg.caption1: Donald Trump said that he planns to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.
956.jpg.caption2: Racially-charged reports that Donald Trump said that he wanted to get rid of specific social programs originated from a hoax news site.

959.jpg.caption1: Joe and Joshua appreciate a neighbour's rainbow in support of our NHS.

966.png.caption1: A white woman named Ricky Ellsworth was killed by a black police officer in Minneapolis, Minnesota
966.png.caption2: A viral meme got key facts wrong while attempting to make a point about police violence and racial injustice in the U.S.

995.jpg.caption1: Emma Billingham: "Jumping on the baking bandwagon with the rest of the UK in lockdown. Eating the mixture is always the best part of the baking process."

215.jpg.caption1: People walk through the snow in Victoria Park in Glasgow.
215.jpg.caption2: No finger in front of the eye was seen in Glasgow on Tuesday.

468.jpg.caption1: A man chases a swarm of desert locusts in Samburu County, Kenya, on 21 May 2020
468.jpg.caption2: Locusts have been congregating in dozens of East African and West Asian countries in 2020, in the worst swarms in decades

535.jpg.caption1: Yet another quiet evening falls over Singapore's Kallang Basin outside the window

545.jpg.caption1: Undated handout issued by Kensington Palace entitled Thank You by Wendy Huson, part of the Hold Still digital exhibition launched by the Duchess of Cambridge in collaboration with the National Portrait Gallery.
545.jpg.caption2: Everyday Hero - Richard by Arnhel de Serra, part of the Hold Still digital exhibition

599.jpg.caption1: A butterfly interrupts play at the Australian Open

658.jpg.caption2: A pilot walks across HMS Queen Elizabeth's flight deck

696.jpg.caption1: Police spray a water cannon at protesters during a demonstration in Paris
696.jpg.caption2: Thousands protest against French bill to curb identification of police

710.jpg.caption1: The sculpture stopped the train from plummeting 10m (32ft) into water below, and the driver walked away uninjured.
710.jpg.caption2: A metro train rests precariously on an art installation of a whale in Spijkenisse, near Rotterdam, Netherlands, 2 November 2020

770.jpg.caption1: The two planets have not been this close to each other in a dark sky for 800 years, and are seen here from southern Spain.
770.jpg.caption2: In rare celestial ‘Great Conjunction’ Saturn and Jupiter in planetary intimacy

853.jpg.caption1: The show is part of the gold-producing nation's newly launched International Gold Fair.
853.jpg.caption2: A woman ties and fastens another woman's headwrap at an event in Mali - Friday 12 February 2021

887.jpg.caption1: Bulgarian men perform the traditional "Horo" dance in the icy winter waters of the Tundzha river in the town of Kalofer, as part of Epiphany Day celebrations on 6 January 2021.
887.jpg.caption2: Despite the current measures to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus in Bulgaria, the town of Kalofer organised an Epiphany, a traditional Christian Orthodox feast celebrated on the morning of January 6

930.jpg.caption1: The sandstorms were expected to shift south towards the Yangtze River delta and should clear by Wednesday or Thursday, the environment ministry said.
930.jpg.caption2: A woman wearing a head covering is seen in front of the headquarters of China's state media broadcaster CCTV that is shrouded in haze after a sandstorm in the Central Business District of Beijing, on 15 March 2021

996.jpg.caption1: A Tigrayan forces tank sits abandoned by the side of the road in Mehoni on Friday.
996.jpg.caption2: A woman carrying crops walks next to an abandoned tank belonging to Tigrayan forces south of the town of Mehoni, Ethiopia, on December 11, 2020.
